intro: Tariri ciliata, commonly known as the silky tariri, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
